context: The Finnish word 'lue' is the imperative form of the verb 'lukea', which means 'to read'. It's used when giving a direct command to someone (singular) to read something. The infinitive form is 'lukea', and other forms include 'luen' (I read), 'luet' (you read), 'lukee' (he/she/it reads), 'luemme' (we read), 'luette' (you all read), and 'luelivat/lukivat' (they read).
